product_name: Bru Instant Coffee, 100g: Amazon.in: Grocery & Gourmet Foods

reviews.review_body: We have been using This bru coffee for 20 years. I can clearly sense the diminishing aroma and taste of this item. it is becoming worse day by day. Recently i tried Continental Coffee at my relatives home which i found it very tasty. So, I bought continental coffee : Instant south blend which is absolutely having a good taste. So, I thought why should i encourage a british brand when i can find an indian brand which is more tasty and has good value for money.So, Why don't you try that one?
It's really very good as far as taste is concerned.A perfect alternative to nescafe at much lower cost.Add just a cup of milk and sugar and your coffee is rock ready.
Considering the price its great. If you prefer Nescafe over Bru, remember you'll get Bru Gold at that price.

I can’t say about the numerous positive reviews I am seeing on this, but I personally feel this coffee is a total disaster. Coming to taste, there is none of it. And then there is that strange odour every time I open the jar as well as when I am sipping it. It’s not a 100% coffee as you can see on its packet. Its of 70% coffee and 30% chicory which is used as a “substitute” to the coffee and probably the reason for it’s awkward smell and taste. Would never buy it and since nescafe gold is out of stock, going back to my home nescafe classic..:p
Price is same as shown on package so Amazon must give some discount on products
Traditionally I like Bru instant coffee because of its classic taste and aroma with a nostalgic feeling, happiness and energy

Bad taste! Wonder if it's original Bru!Disappointed with the taste.Bru is one of the best brands in instant coffee and this packet which we received is a sub standard one.Feeling sceptical about buying packaged items online!
Nice  Coffee. It contains Chicory But that is not a bad thing as Chicory is good for you and it means this gives less caffeine
